Rooms & Suites Each of our accessible guest rooms and suites is equipped with an emergency visual fire/smoke alarm. In addition to standard accessible communication features, the following communication features are available by request: TTY telephone Indicator light, lamp flash and/or bed shaker for door, phone and/or alarm clock ​ In addition to standard accessible mobility features, the following mobility features are available by request: Guest room near elevator Toilet seat riser (with or without arms) Transfer tub seat Explore more details and photos of our accessible rooms and suites in our Accommodations section. To request any of the above features, simply call our reservations team at (877) 724-3191. Key Areas Accessible routes to key areas of the resort include: Accessible self-parking is located north of the main entrance Main entrance and lobby are wheelchair/mobility device accessible with full valet and bell service Wheelchair/mobility device accessible Registration and Concierge desk located in the main lobby Standard routes to the following areas are wheelchair/mobility device accessible: Guest Rooms Shopping boutiques at the resort and Via Flagler by The Breakers The Spa Ocean Fitness The Beach Club Golf & Tennis Clubhouse (contact Guest Relations for guest shuttle information) Standard routes to all restaurants are wheelchair/mobility device accessible, with the following exception: HMF and The Circle are wheelchair/mobility device accessible by taking the ADA lift located adjacent to the North Lobby elevators Henry's Palm Beach (at Via Flagler) is wheelchair/mobility device accessible by using the ramp located just east of Henry's, adjacent to Main Street by The Breakers The following event spaces are wheelchair/mobility device accessible from the south side of the hotel via the South Loggia: Venetian Ballroom Mediterranean Ballroom The following event spaces are wheelchair/mobility device accessible from the north side of the hotel by taking the North Lobby Elevators to the first floor, proceeding east down the corridor to the North Oceanfront Elevators and returning to the ground level: Magnolia Room Gulfstream Meeting Rooms The historic Mediterranean Courtyard is not wheelchair/mobility device accessible Other Features: Wheelchair/mobility device accessible complimentary guest shuttle to: Golf & Tennis Facilities, Flagler Steakhouse, Echo and Via Flagler (including Henry's Palm Beach, Main Street by The Breakers and SHAN) Pool and whirlpool spa lifts For further assistance and details, please contact Guest Relations at (877) 724-3191. Policy on Website Accessibility The Breakers Palm Beach, Inc. is committed to diversity, inclusion and accessibility. These core values are fundamental to the way we do business and manifest themselves in the experiences we design for people–both at our resort and on the web. With this in mind, we are actively taking steps to improve thebreakers.com and to the extent practicable ensure it complies with the best practices and standards defined by the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0 . While we strive to make the company’s website as accessible as possible, and are currently updating our site to meet the WCAG 2.0 standards, our pages may not always pass online testing or validation tools. In addition to the company’s efforts to improve the accessibility of its website, it urges third-party vendors providing content on its websites to adhere to the WCAG 2.0 standard and will consider compliance with this standard when selecting third party vendors, however some third-party content that currently appears on our site is outside of our ability to control. Our website is monitored and tested internally and evaluated by third-party accessibility consultants periodically. These people help us identify usability issues and discover new solutions to further improve the accessibility of our site. These tasks include design reviews and quality assurance testing with assistive technology. The company’s Digital Marketing Manager conducts monthly automated scans and periodic manual evaluations to monitor, analyze and help repair accessibility issues found in our website. As we continue to improve the accessibility of our website, we will review this policy to ensure that it reflects the company’s efforts and commitment to accessibility. This Policy is managed by the company's Digital Marketing Manager and reviewed annually by the Director of Compliance and Process Analysis. The company is committed to making its website accessible to customers with disabilities. In order to maintain an open channel of communication with our users, we welcome feedback on the usability and accessibility of the company's website. Questions or concerns about the accessibility of thebreakers.com should be directed by email to [email protected] . Explore more details and photos of our accessible rooms and suites in our Accommodations section . To review features and availability, simply call our reservations team at (877) 724-3191. Almost. Introducing membership at The Breakers Ocean Club: distinctive offerings that unlock a new dimension in luxury. Ocean Membership Four glittering pools, six whirlpool spas, 10 restaurants, 13 shopping boutiques—it’s all at your fingertips when you choose to become an esteemed Ocean Member at The Breakers. By day, enjoy unbridled access to the resort’s private beach, two fitness centers, two golf courses and new world-class racquet facilities with 12 tennis courts, two dedicated pickleball courts and two padel courts. By night, gather with your family and friends at any of our restaurants and bars—from the glamorous HMF social club to Flagler Steakhouse, our classic-meets-contemporary take on fine American dining. What’s more, your membership comes with exclusive perks and complimentary services—from preferred accommodation rates and exclusive discounts at our shops, restaurants and spa to gratis green fees at both the Ocean Course and the championship Rees Jones® Course. VIEW BROCHURE Beach & Tennis Membership Outdoor enthusiasts, look no further. Our coveted Beach & Tennis Membership grants you complete access to The Breakers’ Beach Club, an idyllic oceanfront oasis complete with four pools, six whirlpool spas, direct beach access and several beloved restaurants and bars. Just beyond the property’s Beach Club, treat friends to a game of doubles our new world-class racquet facilities, or opt for a private lesson with one of our pros. After your match, recline in the privacy of a private poolside bungalow, or retreat to our luxury indoor-outdoor spa. Your membership also provides exclusive discounts at our shops, spa, restaurants and bars. Golf & Tennis Membership Few things can evoke the resort lifestyle quite like golf. Here at The Breakers, our Golf Membership gives way to the golfer’s dream: complete access to 36 holes of golf, as well as our new world-class racquet facilities, which feature 12 tennis courts, two dedicated pickleball courts and two padel courts. From first tee to your final cocktail after the 18th hole, every detail of your golfing experience is elevated by membership. Enjoy complimentary green fees at both the Ocean Course and the championship Rees Jones Course®, as well as complimentary court times, and exclusive discounts at our shops, spa and many of our bars and restaurants. CONTACT US Ready to Join? To learn more about unique membership privileges, pricing and requirements, submit your inquiry. Or, speak with someone by calling (877) 724-4068. For Our Members Membership at The Breakers means one-of-a-kind service. If you’re a current member and have a question or special request, simply call us at (877) 724-4068. About Us - Hixson Metal Finishing Home About Us Media Services Anodizing NDT Chem Film Plating Paint Special Processes [PDF of all Processes] Approvals Accreditation Request for Quote Contact Customer Portals Customer Portal Customer Feedback Select Page About Us Hixson Metal Finishing (“HMF”) is a premier metal finishing company with a vision rooted in excellence, integrity, and accountability. Since the early 1960s, we have been working diligently to provide a broad range of services to the military, aerospace, and commercial aircraft communities with competitive prices, timely delivery, and outstanding quality. HMF is a full-service provider offering more than 80 metal finishing, testing, and inspection processes. We place a significant emphasis on two things: producing high-quality results and fostering strong relationships with our customers. To facilitate open and effective communication, we have an online system that allows customers to check the real-time status of their jobs. We are also committed to continuously improving our processes and creating innovative approaches to exceed our customer’s expectations. With hundreds of years of collective metal finishing experience our leadership team and employees are among the most qualified and committed in the industry. As a dynamic enterprise with a top-tier quality system, we have earned approvals and are in compliance with the National Aerospace and Defense Contractors Accreditation Program (Nadcap), AS9100, and the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). We provide best-in-class service to both small shops and industry leading companies, such as Boeing, Lockheed Martin, and Parker Hannifin. Our attention to detail assures that the Hixson team will work diligently to make our customer’s experience with us rewarding. Our History Hixson Metal Finishing (“HMF”) was founded in 1958 in Newport Beach, California. The company started as a niche commercial metal finishing processor catering to the local boating community for decorative chrome plating. HMF rapidly gained a reputation for providing the highest quality plating capable of withstanding the tough and rigorous ocean environments. As the aerospace industry began to take off in Southern California in the 1960s, HMF shifted its focus to this growing market opportunity. Over time, we extended our service offerings and began providing the same quality and long-lasting commitment to the more stringent and exacting requirements of the commercial aircraft industry. HMF is now a leading industries of metal components for the commercial, Aerospace and Defense (“A&D”) industry. With over 80 processes performed in-house, we have become a single-source, end-to-end service provider committed to excellence and craftsmanship. Our reputation is built on a partnering philosophy with our 3,000 plus customers worldwide, both large and small. Core Values Our values define who we are. By committing to our values, we are investing in the long-term future of our organization. Expressing and being the embodiment of these values allows us to achieve new heights in the service that we provide our customers and the quality of our workplace. Continuous Improvement This is our way of life. We are invested in the continual pursuit of improvement and change that benefits our customers, suppliers and employees. We focus on finding solutions and delivering results. We build durability in our future by acting with speed and flexibility to anticipate obstacles and create new and innovative opportunities. Quality We hire the best people and employ effective methodologies to ensure exceptional results. Our core focus is to deliver premier service to our customers ensuring that their requirements are met and expectations exceeded. Accountability We hold ourselves accountable to provide the highest standards of service, punctual delivery, reliability and open communication. Paramount to our customer experience is being responsible for what we promise and aligning our actions to our words. Respect We value the diversity and unique contributions of our employees. Our daily mission is to promote an atmosphere that is supportive and values an individual’s experience, style and approach. Integrity We are guided by the highest standards of ethical business conduct by one simple principle: Do the right thing. Our culture inspires people to go the extra mile and to make good decisions even when nobody is looking. We are ethically unyielding and straightforward in all of our interactions. Empowerment We are committed to fostering an environment of growth and enrichment for our employees. By providing our employees with the necessary resources and encouragement, we maximize their contributions to our customers, our industry, and our company. Collaboration Our employees are proud and confident to be key players on a winning team that shares a common mission, vision, and set of values. Our goal is to ensure all employees feel valued and appreciated. Fun We promote a positive, energizing and enjoyable environment that focuses on building a sense of community. Corporate Responsibility Hixson Metal Finishing (“HMF”) is proud to provide top quality processing services to the commercial, aerospace and defense industry in an environmentally sound and responsible manner. We strive to be the best supplier in the industry and have worked tirelessly to maintain and expand our corporate social responsibility initiatives. We have done so by enhancing the following: Improved Chrome VI capturing technology Switched to alternative low or zero VOC containing products Modernized waste treatment facility Reduced chemical inventory Updated our fleet to cleaner burning, fuel-efficient vehicles We have introduced many environmental processes and procedures Hixson Team Our attention to detail assures that the Hixson team will work diligently to make our customer’s experience with us rewarding. Eat, Drink and Be Scary at HMF’s Hauntingly-Haute Halloween Celebration WHAT: In recognition of All Hallows’ Eve, HMF at The Breakers Palm Beach is hosting a special “spookeasy” soirée. Set amongst dramatic décor, this frightfully fang-tastic evening will feature a spine-chilling selection of festive menu items: Monster Lobster Sushi Roll w arm Maine lobster, asparagus, avocado, spicy sauce, crispy wonton, eel sauce and red tobiko Black Lagoon Seabass Ceviche coconut ají amarillo leche de tigre, jingle bell peppers, cilantro, red onion, crispy tostones Out of the Crypt Mini Cider Donuts Ceylon cinnamon, salted caramel and bourbon vanilla ice cream. Spooky Peanut Butter Mousse Cobweb Pie Chocolate cookie crust, meringue and candied peanuts Guests will also enjoy spooktacular signature cocktails such as Black Widow (mezcal, lemon, honey, rosemary and blackberry); Blood Type O (tequila, Cointreau, blood orange puree, lime juice and agave) ; Eye See You (vodka, lychee juice, Cointreau, vermouth and lemon juice) ; Nightmare on Bourbon Street (bourbon, blood orange liqueur, lemon juice, ginger beer and Luxardo cherry); and Witches Brew (vodka, Chambord, pineapple juice, topped with Champagne). WHEN: Friday, October 31, 2025 | 6 PM - 12 AM WHERE: HMF at The Breakers | One South County Rd., Palm Beach MORE: Costumes are highly encouraged | For more information please call (561) 659-8480 PHOTO: Nightmare on Bourbon Street Cocktail ### About The Breakers Palm Beach One of America’s most iconic resorts, The Breakers is an Italian Renaissance-style hotel, set within 140 acres of oceanfront property on the island of Palm Beach, Florida. Founded in 1896 by magnate Henry M. Flagler, this legendary destination continues to thrive independent of chain affiliation under its original family ownership. Their unrivaled investment, averaging $30 million each year in capital improvements and ongoing revitalization, balances preservation and modernization to sustain multi-generational appeal. Inspired by the Villa Medici in Rome, the magnificent, eight-story architectural centerpiece features 534 guest rooms and suites, including the ultra-luxury Flagler Club - a boutique, private-access hotel nestled atop of the resort. A bounty of world-class amenities complement The Breakers’ gracious service and unparalleled seaside glamour. Ten distinctive restaurants, ranging from casual beachfront to stylishly sophisticated, showcase talented, award-winning chefs and Master Sommeliers. An exclusive beach club evokes the Mediterranean, with four pools, six whirlpool spas, 25 poolside bungalows and a variety of watersports. Additional offerings include: two 18-hole golf courses, tennis and racquet facilities debuting in late 2024, a tranquil, indoor-outdoor spa, a 6,000 sq. ft. fitness center, 13 signature boutiques, a Family Entertainment Center with extensive activities for children, and Via Flagler by The Breakers - an off-site, al fresco plaza of boutiques, eateries and galleries. Along with being recognized as a AAA Five Diamond property, The Breakers has earned numerous accolades for its social impact , reflecting the organization’s unwavering commitment to team member well-being, the community and environment. For reservations or more information, call 888-BREAKERS (273-2537) or visit thebreakers.com . Danish truck cranes since 1952 Since 1952, HMF has specialized in developing truck cranes that are strong , compact , and nice to work with . Together with our skilled employees and dedicated partners we sell, service, and install Danish quality cranes in more than 40 countries. That’s why HMF cranes are used and loved by truck drivers around the entire world . 3-14 tm Loader cranes 15-31 tm Loader cranes 32-59 tm Loader cranes 60-95 tm Loader cranes Compact and light HMF truck cranes are characterized by their light tare weight and compact design. This gives you extra space on the truck body as well as extra kgs for what you need to move. Strong, sturdy, and durable HMF truck cranes are designed to last for many years. With high-tensile steel, dual-coating, and internal hose-routing our cranes are fit for all kinds of weather and terrain. Smooth operation HMF truck cranes are designed for a flexible and smooth operation. This makes them suitable for different kinds of lifting tasks in all kinds of industries. Always an HMF partner near you We have a global network of sales and service partners ready to help you out with your truck crane concerns. Whether you need help with purchase, retrofitting, service - or just a piece of advice. Simply contact your local HMF partner. Find your HMF partner Partners through the lifetime of your crane One thing is to buy a truck crane. Another is to be sure that your crane operates as intended after you get it - and continues to do so . HMF is not only a manufacturer of strong, reliable, and lightweight loader cranes. You can also count on us to support your business for years after you buy your crane. Fact Sheet Skip to main content MENU CALL Check Availability Accommodations Guest Rooms Suites Flagler Club Accessible Rooms & Suites Amenities Browse All Accommodations Activities Pools & Beach Bungalows The Spa Fitness Golf Racquet Sports Shopping Family Activities Holiday Events Browse All Activities Dining HMF Flagler Steakhouse Seafood Bar Echo Henry’s Palm Beach The Italian Restaurant The Circle The Beach Club Restaurant Ocean House The Surf Break In-Room Dining Sunday Brunch Special Events & Holidays Browse All Dining Events Meetings Weddings & Celebrations Venues & Floor Plans Browse All Events Special Offers Resort Offers Dining Offers Browse All Special Offers Photos About The Breakers Mobile App Memberships Gift Cards Contact Us Careers Call: Check Availability Check Availability Press Resource Center General Information Fact Sheet Resort Overview Resort Profile: One of America’s most iconic resorts, The Breakers is an Italian Renaissance-style hotel situated on 140 acres of oceanfront property on the island of Palm Beach, Florida. Founded in 1896 by magnate Henry Morrison Flagler, and still in the hands of his heirs today, this legendary destination continues to thrive independent of chain affiliation. Renowned for its commitment to social responsibility, The Breakers actively supports its team, the local community, and environmental initiatives. Its historic significance is also recognized nationally, earning a place on the National Register of Historic Places. Architecture: Inspired by the magnificent Italian villas of the 1400s (specifically the Villa Medici in Rome), The Breakers' Mediterranean-style architecture features an eight-story palace by the sea with sun-filled North and South Loggias, iconic Twin Belvedere Towers and graceful arches throughout. The lushly landscaped 1,040-foot, palm-lined main drive leads to the resort’s Florentine Fountain, modeled after the Boboli Gardens in Florence. The hotel’s breathtaking lobby is influenced by the Great Hall of the Palazzo Carrega in Genoa (circa 1560). Location: The Breakers is six miles from Palm Beach International Airport (PBI), 42 miles from Fort Lauderdale–Hollywood International Airport (FLL) and 72 miles from Miami International Airport (MIA). Both Interstate 95 and the Florida Turnpike provide easy access to South County Road, which leads directly to the resort’s main entrance. Climate: With close proximity to the Gulfstream, Palm Beach enjoys a subtropical climate noted for year-round breezes and moderate temperatures ranging from 75-85 degrees. Ownership: Flagler System, Inc. (FSI) is the privately held parent company and original family ownership of The Breakers Palm Beach , Breakers West Country Club , One North Breakers Row , and various commercial real estate properties on the island. Each year, an investment averaging $30 million in capital improvements and ongoing revitalization carefully balances preservation and modernization. Leadership: Paul N. Leone, CEO, and Tricia Taylor, President, lead a dedicated and diverse team of 2,400 employees. Residences: One North Breakers Row is a private enclave of 79 luxurious, oceanfront apartments available for residential lease. Memberships: Access to premium amenities and exclusive courtesies is available through various club memberships at The Breakers Ocean Club and Breakers West Country Club . Accommodations: The resort features 534 guest rooms, including 72 suites—among them are the most elaborate: the Imperial and Royal Poinciana Suites. Each room offers captivating views of the Atlantic or resort grounds, décor inspired by Palm Beach’s casually chic lifestyle and complimentary high-speed WiFi. Childproofing and parental equipment are also available upon request. An intimate, exceptionally customized experience, The Breakers’ luxurious Flagler Club is an exclusive, 21-room boutique hotel nestled atop the resort. Private access leads to beautifully appointed accommodations, top-of-the-line amenities, an elegant Lounge and panoramic rooftop Terrace, as well as personalized service from pre-arrival to departure. Guest Services: Committed to guest satisfaction, the resort’s highly attentive team fulfills a range of services, such as concierge, laundry, valet parking, and complimentary house car/shuttle to off-site restaurants and retail boutiques. Amenities: Ten restaurants range from casual beachfront to stylishly sophisticated, while a world-class private beach club hosts four pools, six whirlpool spas, 25 poolside bungalows and a variety of watersports. In addition, there are two 18-hole golf courses, 16 racquet courts, a world-class indoor/outdoor spa, an oceanfront fitness center, 13 signature boutiques, Via Flagler by The Breakers - an al fresco shopping plaza, and a Family Entertainment Center. There is also never a resort fee. Dining: Flagler Steakhouse : Located on the second floor of The Breakers Golf & Racquet Clubhouse, this fresh take on the classic American chophouse serves a diverse menu of outstanding steaks, fish, classic broiler items and more. The restaurant’s climate-controlled outdoor terrace provides al fresco dining with panoramic views of Ocean Course. HMF : Named after resort founder, Henry M. Flagler, this chic social club gives a modern nod to the classic Palm Beach cocktail culture of the 50s and 60s. The menu flaunts eclectic, globally-influenced shared plates, handcrafted cocktails and an award-winning wine list. Seafood Bar : Creating the sense of dining aboard a luxury, private yacht, this oceanfront restaurant is a dining favorite among guests and Palm Beach residents. The menu boasts the freshest seafood, inspiring cocktails and Master Sommelier-selected wines. The Circle : An architectural gem with arched windows that offer glimpses of the Atlantic and a soaring 30-foot, hand-painted ceiling, The Circle welcomes guests daily for breakfast. Each morning, an artfully crafted buffet, as well as an à la carte menu are served. The restaurant’s spectacular Sunday Brunch is a Palm Beach tradition not to be missed. The Italian Restaurant : This casual, yet contemporary, restaurant is adjacent to the Family Entertainment Center, making it a favorite for guests of all ages. Classic comfort dishes and lighter menu selections highlight the flavors of Italy. Outdoor patio seating is available. Restaurants located off property Echo : Situated only a few minutes from the resort, this stylish, highly popular restaurant spotlights the distinct cuisines of Asia, specifically the aromatic and flavorful specialties of China, Japan, Korea, Thailand and Vietnam. Henry’s Palm Beach : This inviting, American-inspired bistro showcases elevated comfort food with character. It is located at Via Flagler by The Breakers on Royal Poinciana Way, Palm Beach’s original Main Street (minutes from the hotel). Available exclusively for hotel guests and club members In-Room Dining : A complete menu of breakfast, lunch, dinner and light fare is available to enjoy in the privacy of one's guest room. Ocean House : Located at the south end of The Beach Club with gorgeous pool and ocean views, this beach house-style restaurant, with a covered wrap-around porch, welcomes guests with laid-back luxury. An inspired daytime menu of light bites, colorful salads, sandwiches, seafood and refreshing cocktails can be enjoyed among swaying palms and sea breezes. The Beach Club Restaurant : Coming Soon -this transformation will feature a stylishly relaxed setting serving coastal Mediterranean cuisine. Learn more . The Surf Break : Steps from the shore, this open-air oasis envelops guests with tranquil breezes and ocean views; guests can relax with a refreshing cocktail or light bite. Recreation & Activities: Beach Club : Exclusively available for hotel guests and club members, the resort’s private Beach Club treats visitors to magnificent vistas of the ocean, as well as: Four Pools & Six Whirlpool Spas : Includes an adult-only pool and zero-entry pool—ideal for families. 25 Poolside Bungalows : Available for daytime rental, these premium poolside cabanas are the perfect oasis for couples, families and friends. Each vibrant, island-chic retreat has a private full bathroom with shower, an individual climate control system, a dedicated concierge and much more. Watersports : Splash the day away with a variety of activities such as kayaking, paddleboarding, boogie boarding and more. Family Entertainment Center : Activities, entertainment and games for guests of all ages can be found at this 6,100-square-foot, multi-faceted complex: Arcade : Explore more than 20 classic and contemporary games, from Skee-Ball, Super Shot Basketball and air hockey to a video game lounge with Xbox® and PlayStation® 4. Family Programs : Specially designed daily activities are available for guests of all ages and varying interests, from poolside spin art and campfire films to bike rentals, trivia and more. Outdoor Playground : The 4,500-square-foot playground is designed for movement with slides, tunnels, bridges and other park-like activities. Sunshades and outdoor lighting allow for family fun day or night. Recreation : A nine-hole mini golf course and outdoor basketball court are perfect for individual or group play. Golf : Two 18-hole courses deliver variety and playability for all levels. Ocean Course : Discover acre upon acre of lush greens at one of Florida’s oldest golf courses. Most recently redesigned by renowned golf course architect Rees Jones, Ocean Course offers contemporary playability for all skill levels. The Breakers Rees Jones® Course : Located 10 miles from the resort and set against the backdrop of the picturesque Breakers West residential community, The Breakers Rees Jones® Course allows for flexible play with varying degrees of risk, reflecting the signature style for which this eminent architect is known. John Webster Golf Academy : Nationally recognized golf professionals provide instruction in private lesson and golf school formats, ideal for players of all skill levels. Children’s clinics and custom club fittings are available. Ocean Fitness : This spectacular, 6,000-square-foot, indoor-outdoor fitness center is located above the resort’s Beach Club complex. An array of resources help individuals reach their personal fitness goals in an inspiring ocean-view setting. A network of customized fitness solutions includes state-of-the-art equipment, expert personal training and complimentary fitness classes . A half mile away, guests may bike, jog or take a leisurely stroll outdoors along the Intracoastal Waterway on Palm Beach’s Lake Trail. Tennis : The new, world-class tennis & racquet facilities feature 16 state-of-the-art, open-air courts - inclusive of tennis, pickleball and padel - each with an exclusive comfort and refreshment station. Players have a choice of three surfaces for preferred tennis play (hydroponic grass, hydro clay or cushioned hardtop). Clinics and private lessons with USPTA/USPTR-certified professional instructors are available, while covered and lighted courts provide flexible play options. The Shops at The Breakers : Absolutely Suitable® – designer swimwear and accessories Guerlain – fragrance, skincare and cosmetics direct from Paris Mary Lily’s® – sweet treats, ice cream, frozen custard and gelato Match at The Breakers® – the ultimate shoe salon for resort footwear Mix at The Breakers® – fine and fashion jewelry and accessories News & Gourmet® – artisan coffee, distinctive gifts, books and more Polo Ralph Lauren – contemporary apparel from a classic American designer Polo Ralph Lauren Kids – timeless attire for boys, girls and baby Signature Shop – private label collections of logo’ed clothing and accessories The Beach Shop – sun products, beach toys, hats and more The Sports Pro Shop – sports apparel and equipment boutique Off-site boutiques located at Via Flagler by The Breakers : Main Street by The Breakers® – gift shop & classic café with donuts, home décor and more SHAN – high-end resort wear and swimwear The Spa : The indoor-outdoor spa embraces guests with a contemporary, Italian-inspired design and a fresh, soothing atmosphere that engages all the senses. Amenities include 17 treatment rooms; a private courtyard; lounges for men, women and co-ed use; and a salon area for hair and nail services. A carefully curated menu of treatments, delivered by expertly trained professionals, features the finest, handcrafted skin and body care products. Meetings & Events: Conference Services : With over 80,000 square feet of versatile meeting space, The Breakers offers a diverse array of indoor and outdoor venues ideal for events of 50 to 1,000 guests. From grand ballrooms and executive boardrooms to beautifully landscaped lawns, courtyards, and gardens, each setting provides its own unique character and style. Our dedicated team delivers highly personalized service, comprehensive in-house support, and expert audiovisual production to ensure every event is seamless and memorable. Weddings & Social Events : A celebrated destination for unforgettable celebrations, The Breakers offers guests an experience of seaside glamour, gracious hospitality, and world-class amenities—all set within an atmosphere of relaxed elegance. From majestic ballrooms and oceanfront lawns overlooking the Atlantic to charming courtyards framed by lush tropical foliage, each venue is thoughtfully designed to inspire and impress.  Just 10 miles away, Breakers West Country Club , provides an additional scenic setting within a tranquil residential and recreational enclave. Our seasoned team of event specialists is dedicated to crafting extraordinary experiences, tailoring every detail to reflect each client’s unique vision. In-house culinary experts—including award-winning chefs and Master Sommeliers—create custom menus, curated wine pairings, and inventive cocktail presentations. The resort’s retail division also offers bespoke gifting and amenities. With flawless execution and personalized service, every celebration at The Breakers is nothing short of spectacular. At #HMF , we understand that the integrity of civil and structural assets underpins the safe and reliable operation of the UK’s energy infrastructure. Substations' foundations, gantries, control buildings, and cable trenches must be maintained to the highest standards to support long-term network performance.

Our Structural Condition Assessment services combine both intrusive and non- destructive techniques to deliver a clear, data-driven understanding of asset health. By balancing minimal disruption with engineering precision, we ensure our clients make informed decisions about maintenance, refurbishment, or replacement.

Our Approach:
✅ Non-Destructive Assessment
Visual inspections for cracking, spalling, corrosion, and deformation
Rebound hammer testing to evaluate surface hardness
Hammer sound testing to detect voids, and hidden defects
Ferro Scanning to detect presence of rebars

✅Intrusive Assessment
Core sampling and reinforcement exposure for in-depth structural analysis
Laboratory testing of concrete and steel for strength and durability
Chemical testing including chloride and sulphate testing

✅ Actionable Insights
We deliver comprehensive reports with prioritised recommendations, helping clients plan maintenance strategies, extend asset life, and ensure compliance with industry standards.

Photo Credit to Amy W . 5 Like Comment Share HMF Consultants 2,717 followers 1w Report this post Earth Potential Rise (EPR) – A Critical Factor in Electrical Safety

In this blog, we explain what Earth Potential Rise (EPR) is, how it occurs during fault conditions, and why it’s essential for protecting personnel, equipment, and infrastructure in facilities such as substations.

EPR can create dangerous touch and step voltages, damage sensitive equipment, and even interfere with communication systems — making it a serious concern in high-current fault scenarios.

To address these risks, we explore practical mitigation methods including robust grounding systems, soil conditioning, and controlled potential zones that help minimize hazards and ensure continuity of operations.

Turn the corner into the North Loggia and you’ll see it: everyone dressed to the nines, abuzz in our exquisite Florentine Room—where the glitterati drank and dined for decades—reinvented as the dazzling and modern HMF, Palm Beach’s hottest gathering place. Named after the resort’s founder, Henry Morrison Flagler, HMF is steeped in the glamour of an earlier era, yet wholly current. This chic social club boasts an eclectic, globally influenced menu, an acclaimed wine list of more than 2,200 unique selections and an array of inventive cocktails. Grab a seat and people watch as you listen to the transformative sounds of Kirill Basov, our renowned music and entertainment director known for his dreamy, distinctive mash-ups of old and new. The Breakers Expands its Selection of Meaningful Team Member Programs to Further Enrich Its Renowned Workplace Culture PALM BEACH, FL - At the heart of The Breakers Palm Beach , one of America’s most iconic resorts, is a purpose-driven, family-owned organization that is guided by a ‘people-first’ philosophy. For more than 129 years, the company’s employee-centric culture has shaped this dynamic workplace that is devoted to team member fulfillment - which plays a pivotal role in the property’s enduring success and reputation for excellence. Continuing this legacy, The Breakers has introduced new initiatives focused on mental health, preventative care, personal development, and community service - key pillars that support the organization’s fundamental social impact values. These efforts have contributed to a remarkable 90% average retention rate and a 94% team member pride rating, based on the most recent Employee Opinion Survey. “Our long-standing owners, heirs of founder Henry Flagler (circa 1896), are unwavering in their commitment to social responsibility, with the well-being of our 2,400 team members at the forefront,” said Denise Bober, Senior Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer at The Breakers. “By fostering an engaging work environment grounded in purpose, connection and personal growth, we inspire our employees to thrive, in turn, they encourage their family, friends, colleagues and community to flourish as well.” LATEST WORKPLACE INITIATIVES: On-Site Mental Health Counseling with Marquee Health In February 2025, The Breakers broadened its employee wellness offerings with the introduction of a mental health counselor, in partnership with Marquee Health . This complimentary program provides associates with confidential, one-on-one meetings to support emotional well-being and resilience. The goal: to create a safe, trusted space for employees to receive timely, evidence-based care that fosters insights, healing and successful outcomes. Highlights include: Private, in-person sessions with a licensed mental health clinician Guidance for a wide range of emotional and behavioral issues such as anxiety, depression, grief, relationships, substance abuse and/or trauma Six complimentary sessions available annually, with continued consultations accessible via The Breakers’ Employee Assistance Program and/or insurance Household and family members of each employee also have access to counseling opportunities via the Employee Assistance Program “Our team has expressed immediate interest in prioritizing their mental health as appointments have booked up quickly through our on-site Wellness Clinic,” shared Cara Striluk, Benefits Services Manager at The Breakers. “Initial feedback has been overwhelmingly positive. Marquee Health gives associates a wonderful opportunity to explore the benefits of therapy in a trusted setting,” she continued. OnSight Eyes As part of its growing suite of preventative care services to identify potential health risks, The Breakers debuted a new partnership with OnSight Eyes in February 2025. This comprehensive mobile clinic brings eye care directly to the workplace, allowing team members to complete eye exams, renew contact lenses, shop for eyewear and/or receive prescription fulfillment from a board-certified optometrist during their scheduled shifts. OnSight Eyes joins The Breakers’ lineup of mobile wellness partners, which includes Florida Mobile Mammography , Jet Dental and OnSpot Dermatology - making high-quality, preventative healthcare more accessible and convenient for every team member. MyBaby Sleepology Recognizing the vital role sleep plays in family wellness, The Breakers recently introduced MyBaby Sleepology - a hands-on workshop facilitated by a certified sleep expert. Designed for employees who are parents of children from infancy to age five, these sessions use a science-based methodology and practical tools to improve sleep routines and quality of life. An overview of topics feature: Common causes of disrupted sleep in young children Effective strategies to prevent night wakings and early risings Age-appropriate nap schedules and tips for lengthening naps Overview of the four most popular sleep training methods Optimizing sleep environments and bedtime routines “This program gave me clear, actionable tips to help my child sleep better,” shared a Breakers’ team member. “After implementing the guidance, I’ve already seen a positive shift in my 8-month old’s sleep habits.” Annual Day of 100,000 Meals In partnership with The Palm Beach County Food Bank , The Breakers hosted two “Day of 100,000 Meals” events as part of its GIVES volunteer program - collectively packing 222,000 dinners for food-insecure families across Palm Beach County. With 1 in 11 local residents struggling to put food on the table, and 1 in 7 children going to bed hungry, The Breakers’ team mobilized to make a powerful impact - ultimately helping to feed over 1.3M people. GIVES encourages employees to use work time to support agencies through the use of Community Service Hours. Each year, full-time team members receive 16 hours (part-time employees receive 8-hours) to contribute time, energy and resources to non-profit organizations of their choice. In 2024, The Breakers contributed more than 35,000 volunteer hours to 274 local agencies. For additional information on The Breakers’ expansive social impact programs that highlight Team, Community and Environment, please refer to the 2024 Social Impact Report . ### About The Breakers Palm Beach One of America’s most iconic resorts, The Breakers is an Italian Renaissance-style hotel, set within 140 acres of oceanfront property on the island of Palm Beach, Florida. Founded in 1896 by magnate Henry M. Flagler, this legendary destination continues to thrive independent of chain affiliation under its original family ownership. Each year, an unrivaled investment averaging $30 million in capital improvements and ongoing revitalization, balances preservation and modernization to sustain multi-generational appeal. Inspired by the Villa Medici in Rome, the magnificent, eight-story architectural centerpiece features 534 guest rooms and suites, including the ultra-luxury Flagler Club - a boutique, private-access hotel nestled atop the resort. A bounty of world-class amenities complements The Breakers’ gracious service and unparalleled seaside glamour. Ten distinctive restaurants, ranging from casual beachfront to stylishly sophisticated, showcase talented, award-winning chefs and Master Sommeliers. An exclusive beach club evokes the Mediterranean, with four pools, six whirlpool spas, 25 poolside bungalows and a variety of watersports. Additional offerings include two 18-hole golf courses, 16 racquet courts, a tranquil, indoor-outdoor spa, a 6,000 sq. ft. fitness center, 13 signature boutiques, a Family Entertainment Center with extensive activities for children, and Via Flagler by The Breakers - an off-site, al fresco plaza of boutiques, eateries and galleries. The Breakers has earned numerous accolades for its social impact , reflecting the organization’s unwavering commitment to team member well-being, the community and environment. For reservations or more information, call 888-BREAKERS (273-2537) or visit thebreakers.com . Now into its second century, the resort not only enjoys national and international acclaim, but it continues to thrive under the ownership of Flagler’s heirs. Flagler’s Fortune and Florida’s East Coast When Henry Morrison Flagler first visited Florida in March 1878, he had accumulated a vast fortune with the Standard Oil Company (today Exxon Mobil) in Cleveland and New York as a longtime partner of John D. Rockefeller. In 1882, with the founding of the Standard Oil Trust, the then 52-year-old was earning and able to depend on an annual income of several million from dividends. Impressed by Florida’s mild winter climate, Flagler decided to gradually withdraw from the company's day-to-day operations and turn his vision toward Florida and his new role of resort and railroad developer. In 1885, Flagler acquired a site and began the construction of his first hotel in St. Augustine, Florida. Ever the entrepreneur, he continued to build south towards Palm Beach, buying and building Florida railroads and rapidly extending lines down the state's east coast. As the Florida East Coast Railroad opened the region to development and tourism, Flagler continued to acquire or construct resort hotels along the route. Hotel Royal Poinciana In 1893, Flagler announced one of his boldest plans – to extend the Florida East Coast Railroad to the isolated area of Lake Worth and construct the Hotel Royal Poinciana on the lake’s eastern shore. Touting warmer weather and easy access, it is as if at his command, the cream of American society crowded into this tiny town to experience the Royal Poinciana, his six-story, 1,100-room, Georgian-style hotel. From its opening in 1894, the Royal Poinciana eventually became the world's largest hotel, stretching more than 1,800 feet along Lake Worth. The hallways were so extensive – more than three miles in length – that bellhops delivered messages and packages to guest rooms via bicycle. Palm Beach Inn (The Original Breakers) Delighted that many of America's most socially prominent families shared his love for Palm Beach, Flagler built a second hotel - Palm Beach Inn - on the beachfront portion of the Royal Poinciana's property. The Palm Beach Inn, which opened on January 16, 1896, was fully booked for most of that first season. The hotel was smaller and quieter than the vast Royal Poinciana and overlooked the Atlantic Ocean. Instead of asking for rooms at the main hotel, many regular Palm Beach guests asked for rooms “down by the breakers.” The name stuck and when Flagler doubled the size of the Palm Beach Inn for the 1901 season, he renamed the hotel The Breakers. On June 9, 1903, as workers were enlarging the wooden building for the fourth time in less than a decade, The Breakers burned down. Just two weeks after the fire, the 73-year-old Flagler announced that The Breakers would not only be rebuilt, it would also open for the upcoming winter season. The Breakers II On February 1, 1904, The Breakers reopened to universal acclaim. The new Breakers, a rambling four-story, colonial-style building constructed entirely of wood, contained 425 rooms and suites. Rooms started at four dollars a night and included three meals a day. As did its predecessor's, The Breakers guest register read like a “who's who” of early-20th century America and included: various Rockefellers, Vanderbilts, and Astors; the tycoons Andrew Carnegie and J.P. Morgan; the publisher William Randolph Hearst; the five-and-dime kings W.T. Grant and J.C. Penney; and even assorted European nobility and U.S. presidents. On March 18, 1925, twelve years after the death of Henry Morrison Flagler, tragedy struck again. That afternoon, the cry “fire in the south wing” suddenly filled The Breakers. Despite the firefighters' best efforts, the hotel was doomed. With strong southeast winds, the palatial hotel was soon engulfed in flames. Fortunately, no lives were lost in the blaze, a miracle considering the number of guests and employees. Mayor “Big Bill” Thompson, then the Mayor of Chicago, was a guest at the hotel with his wife for the season. Attending the St. Patrick’s Day Ball the night before, Mrs. Thompson allegedly left her brand new, electric Marcel curling iron on when she departed her guest room, where the fire was proven to have started. Refused to be beaten by this catastrophe and fueled with the same determination and vision as Flagler himself, Flagler’s heirs, led by William R. Kenan, Jr., president of the Florida East Coast Hotel Company and the Florida East Coast Railway Company, and the brother of Flagler’s wife, Mary Lily Kenan Flagler, announced that it would not only build the world's finest resort hotel on the site of The Breakers, but it would do so in time for the opening of the 1926-27 winter season, a little more than a year away. The Breakers That Stands Today – Circa 1926 The Florida East Coast Hotel Company selected the architectural firm Schultze and Weaver, which later designed the Waldorf-Astoria, Pierre, and Sherry Netherlands hotels in New York City, to rebuild The Breakers. During an earlier trip to Rome, Leonard Schultze had admired the Villa Medici (1575) and decided to use this building, Italian Renaissance in design, as the architectural inspiration for The Breakers facade. On December 4, 1925, the New York City-based Turner Construction Company signed a contract to build the new seven-story Breakers. Construction began in January 1926. More than 1,200 construction workers labored around the clock, while 72 artisans from Italy completed the magnificent paintings on the lobby ceilings. The immense structure was completed for $7 million in a scant 11½ months and opened on December 29, 1926, just in time for the start of the Palm Beach season. Exceeding everyone's expectations, the hotel opened showcasing a 200-foot-long main lobby with an arched, hand-painted ceiling; a vast Florentine Dining Room, richly decorated with a beamed ceiling modeled after the Palazzo Davanzati (ca. 1400) in Florence; magnificent North and South Loggias; and shaded terraces and landscaped patios. Far grander than its predecessor, The Breakers was more than America's greatest winter resort, it was an unrivaled masterpiece. The Architectural Forum praised The Breakers as “without doubt one of the most magnificent, successful examples of a palatial winter resort hotel,” (May 1927). The president of Turner Construction Company reported soon after the opening, “Those who know, say it is the finest resort hotel in America, and it is not likely that the circumstances of ownership, time, and place will produce its counterpart in years to come.” Now in its second century, The Breakers continues the tradition of excellence started by Henry Morrison Flagler. Today it remains one of the few, privately-owned resorts independent of chain affiliation. The heirs to the original ownership have successfully maintained and revitalized the hotel, keeping with the Flagler tradition and spending millions on renewal and expansion. With their commitment, capital expenditures averaging $30 million a year continue to be reinvested, ensuring The Breakers remains energized and alluring to future generations. DOWNLOAD TIMELINE PDF HISTORIC TIMELINE OF THE BREAKERS 1893 Henry Morrison Flagler purchases 140 acres between the Atlantic Ocean and Lake Worth. 1894 On February 11, Flagler opens his first luxury Palm Beach hotel on Lake Worth, the Royal Poinciana, which becomes the largest hotel in the world at the time. The Florida East Coast Railway begins service to West Palm Beach on April 2nd. 1896 Flagler enlarges a winter home on the oceanfront side of his 140-acre property to form the Palm Beach Inn (later renamed The Breakers - see 1901). An extension of Hotel Royal Poinciana, the Palm Beach Inn opened on January 16 and held the designation of being the only oceanfront hotel south of Daytona Beach. Flagler extends the Florida East Coast Railway to Miami and builds the Port of Palm Beach, a 1,000-foot pier off the Palm Beach Inn, which allows travel via steamship to Nassau, Havana and Key West. 1897 Flagler contracts Alexander H. Findlay to build the first nine-hole golf course in Florida. 1899 Due to Palm Beach's growing popularity and new reputation as a “winter paradise,” Hotel Royal Poinciana is enlarged by half its size. 1900 During the summer, Flagler lays foundation for Whitehall, his private residence. 1901 Guests begin to request a room “down by the breakers” and the Palm Beach Inn is officially renamed The Breakers. On August 24, Henry Morrison Flagler (71) marries Mary Lily Kenan (34) in Kenansville, North Carolina. 1902 Mr. & Mrs. Flagler move into Whitehall, one of the great estates in America's Gilded Age, on February 6. This exquisite 55-room marble palace on Lake Worth was built as a gift for Flagler’s bride. Today, Whitehall is known as the Henry Morrison Flagler Museum and it is open for the public to enjoy. 1903 While being enlarged, The Breakers catches fire and burns to the ground on June 9. A magnificent new wooden structure opens in its place on February 1, 1904 and is deemed one of the finest hotels in America. Flagler extends his railroad to the front of the hotel for convenience; tracks remained next to the circular driveway until the late 1920’s. 1913 Following a serious fall at Whitehall, Flagler moves to his seaside Nautilus Cottage where he dies on May 20. 1925 On March 18, the “second” Breakers burns down due to a fire that was allegedly started by one of those “newfangled curling irons.” The Turner Construction Company signs a contract to build the new Breakers on December 4. 1926 In a tribute to Henry Flagler’s vision, his heirs build the current Breakers in a record 11½ months at a cost of $7 million. The hotel opens its doors on December 29, 1926, just in time for the start of season. Inspired by the Italian Renaissance, the exterior design is similar to Flagler’s Ponce de Leon hotel masterpiece, located in St. Augustine, Florida. The resort’s interior boasts both gilded and hand-painted ceilings by Florentine artists, Venetian chandeliers and paintings of great Renaissance rulers. Today, The Breakers is recognized as one of the most splendid architectural and artistic achievements of its era. 1928 As The Breakers increases in popularity, and to accommodate guests more comfortably at dinner, the heirs add The Circle, one of the most picturesque dining rooms in the world. 1930 - 1935 Hotel Royal Poinciana is gradually torn down as The Breakers has become the primary resort in town. 1942 - 1944 On September 10, The Breakers becomes the U.S. Army’s Ream General Hospital where thousands of servicemen and women recuperate from their wounds and illnesses during World War II. Prominent visitors included Eleanor Roosevelt and President Harry Truman. More than a dozen babies, known as “Breakers Babies,” are born at the hotel. IIn May of 1944, the U.S. Army returns The Breakers to its owners, who prepare for reopening on December 24. 1966 The Breakers Ocean Golf Clubhouse opens. 1968 The Breakers adds 150 guest rooms to the east wings, extensive meeting facilities, the Venetian Ballroom and a new Beach Club, which replaces the older Beach Casino. 1970 The Breakers becomes fully air-conditioned. 1971 The Breakers, originally open mid-December to mid-April, commences year-round operation. 1973 The Breakers named to the National Register of Historic Places. 1995 - 1997 The hotel completes a five-year, $75 million renovation program and establishes The Shops at The Breakers, an ever-expanding and evolving collection of world-class boutiques, that includes The Breakers Signature Shop, Guerlain, Absolutely Suitable and more. In 1996,  the resort celebrates its Centennial Anniversary as a Palm Beach and national landmark 1999 The Breakers opens its new oceanfront Spa, Beach Club and Ponce de Leon Ballroom. 2000 Echo, the resort’s first off-site restaurant opens; it features the distinctive cuisines of Asia. 2001 The historic Ocean Course completes a renovation and the new Golf & Tennis Clubhouse opens. 2002 A guest room and suite renovation comes to completion and the Main Drive is redesigned. 2003 The Breakers unveils its new Family Entertainment Center, a complex of activities for all ages. 2004 Famed golf course architect Rees Jones partners with The Breakers on the reconstruction of The Breakers Rees Jones® Course located at Breakers West. 2006 The Breakers unveils a new beachfront redevelopment that includes the addition of two pools, three whirlpool spas, 20 private poolside bungalows, a Beach Gazebo and The Ocean Grill. 2007 A five-year, guest room renovation commences. John Webster Golf Academy opens at both the Ocean Course and The Breakers Rees Jones® Course at Breakers West. 2008 In November, The Breakers opens a new fashion and fine jewelry boutique, Mix at The Breakers®. 2010 - 2012 The resort celebrates the opening of its Guerlain boutique and Signature Shop (2010), as well as Match at The Breakers® - the ultimate resort shoe boutique (2011) . In 2012, The Breakers begins a design partnership with Tihany Design, which launches with the opening of HMF, the resorts chic social club. Its name honors The Breakers legendary founder, Henry Morrison Flagler. 2013 The Breakers introduces The Surf Break - an open-air, oceanfront bar, the Adult Pool and the re-imagined Flagler Steakhouse. The resort embarks on another phase of guest room revitalization. 2014 With views overlooking the Atlantic, the resort opens its 6,000-square-foot, indoor-outdoor Ocean Fitness center. 2015 The Breakers unveils the ultra-luxurious Flagler Club – an exclusive 25-room boutique hotel within the hotel. Following a dramatic transformation, the indoor-outdoor Spa at The Breakers reopens as the resort’s coveted destination for relaxation and personal renewal. Newly re-imagined Ocean House (formerly The Ocean Grill) opens. 2016 Inspired by the yachting lifestyle, the legendary Seafood Bar is completely reimagined by Tihany Design. 2017 The expansion of the south mezzanine meeting spaces increases the number of conference rooms to 32. 2018 Named after Flagler’s wife, Mary Lily’s welcomes visitors with sweet treats. The Breakers’ popular shopping destination, News & Gourmet, undergoes an extensive makeover. The historic Ocean Course unveils a full-scale renovation by award-winning golf architect Rees Jones. 2019 The Imperial and Royal Poinciana Suites in the resort’s south oceanfront tower, along with the hotel’s main lobby, Ponce de Leon Ballroom and 25 poolside bungalows are all refreshed by celebrated Tihany Design. 2020 The resort updates its north tower guest rooms, Gulfstream Meeting Rooms, Ocean Fitness center, and Polo Ralph Lauren and Match boutiques. Reimagining every facet of the employee, guest and member experience, The Breakers implements its comprehensive B SAFE – Health & Safety Initiative. Making its debut on Royal Poinciana Way, Via Flagler by The Breakers opens. This al fresco plaza features a collection of boutiques, eateries and galleries that includes the resort’s second off-site restaurant, Henry’s Palm Beach, and first off-site boutique, SHAN. 2021 Blending a classic café with a contemporary boutique, the resort welcomes Main Street by The Breakers at Via Flagler. On January 16, The Breakers commemorates its 125th anniversary. The Family Entertainment Center reimagines its playground and adds a nine-hole mini golf course. The expansion of digital services includes the debut of a virtual tour and guest app . 2022 The resort heightens its Adult Pool experience, while The Shops at The Breakers completes an extensive series of enhancements to its Guerlain and Absolutely Suitable boutiques, in addition to welcoming Polo Ralph Lauren Kids. Breakers West Country Club modernizes various areas within its clubhouse and debuts a full-scale renovation of the Rees Jones golf course. 2023 Flagler Club — the private access, luxury boutique hotel set atop the resort — is fully remodeled by Tihany Design. Modifications and enhancements are made to four of the resort’s premier event spaces (Venetian Ballroom, Mediterranean Ballroom, Magnolia Room and Gold Room). 2024 A heightened standard of recreational luxury is achieved with new state-of-the-art tennis & racquet facilities. Thanks to our long-standing family ownership, The Breakers continues to reinvest an average of $30 million in annual capital improvements and ongoing revitalization. With its expansive ocean views and bedecked spaces, The Breakers plays host to meetings that are inspired, engaging and decidedly at ease. From small, intensive work sessions to major corporate summits for hundreds, our portfolio of venues —each with its own architectural charms—and flexible floor plans give you license to host the event you’ve imagined. Meet with our team of event professionals and instantly sense The Breakers’ distinction: immense knowledge, discerning taste and unparalleled customer service. From logistics like seating and timing to creative direction and lighting, our experts handle every aspect with elegance and exactness. Revel in the versatility and leisure of our resort: host a morning meeting in one of our striking conference rooms, then continue the conversation over 18 holes of golf. Turn the corner into the North Loggia and you’ll see it: everyone dressed to the nines, abuzz in our exquisite Florentine Room—where the glitterati drank and dined for decades—reinvented as the dazzling and modern HMF, Palm Beach’s hottest gathering place. Named after the resort’s founder, Henry Morrison Flagler, HMF is steeped in the glamour of an earlier era, yet wholly current. This chic social club boasts an eclectic, globally influenced menu, an acclaimed wine list of more than 2,200 unique selections and an array of inventive cocktails. Grab a seat and people watch as you listen to the transformative sounds of Kirill Basov, our renowned music and entertainment director known for his dreamy, distinctive mash-ups of old and new. Hours & Details Open daily Sunday thru Thursday: 6 PM – 11 PM Friday & Saturday: 6 PM – 12 AM (food service till 11 PM) Reservations are not accepted. Dress is cocktail chic, please. Private Dining To explore options for your next event, simply call (877) 724-3188.
